{=5XN4QIDx}A few hours after you leave the training ground, you come across a wounded man lying under a tree. He says he too was attacked by bandits. You share your water with him and try to dress his wounds as best as you can. He tells you he is a traveling doctor. To thank you for your help, he hands you a small bronze artifact which he says was once given to him in payment by a warrior who said only that it was related to 'Neretzes' Folly.' He suspects it might be of great value. You resolve to find out more. The doctor gives you one more bit of information. He overheard the bandits talking about captives they had seized on their raids. They planned to part ways, with one group taking their prisoners to the south, and the other planning to head northwest to sell them to pirates at the port of Ostican. You may be able to help your brother by searching there for your siblings.
{=RESO8GsK}You saved your brothers, and you decided to let {RADAGOS.LINK} go...
{=0KPigNoS}You saved your brothers, and you decided to execute {RADAGOS.LINK} because he caused the death of your parents.

{=VFIwDLed}We found your little brother. But my former partner {HIDEOUT_BOSS.LINK} betrayed me. We came into his camp to negotiate the boy’s release, and he seized us right then and there.[if:convo_angry_voice]
{=GtS8E8DL}Yes, we are all fine. {LITTLE_BROTHER.NAME} is scared but fine... We need to be quick and get the hell out of this place.[if:convo_calm_friendly][ib:confident]
{=moJ2b09r}I'll take him to the nearest fortress immediately. He will be safe there.
{=pE1BvDHr}He led us here. Where are my brothers?
{=UiUANDNL}Well... Looks like we've gotten your brother back to you, so my end of our deal is complete. I'll be making myself scarce now.[ib:hip][if:convo_uncomfortable_voice]
{=aGSAZygD}Perhaps by saving my brother you earned your life back. Very well, go now.

{=E3Bx2Reo}Good Heaven, I’ll need a better description than that. My men have harvested dozens of little brats in this region. Quite good hunting grounds! Sold some of them to some pirates from Ostican, and sent the rest south to a slave market I know, though.[ib:hip][if:convo_snide_voice]
{=7O8IwMgU}Oh, you'll need my help all right, if you want to get them back - alive, that is. See, my boys have some pretty specific instructions about what to do if there's a rescue attempt...

{=QKPrNUuX}Also, I’ll be straight with you, seeing as you’ll find out soon enough anyway. If I recall right, we already sold off your sister to those pirates in Ostican. I remember one of that lot looked a bit like you. So with luck I can help you get your brother back. Your sister – well, I know nothing of ships and the sea, so I couldn’t tell you where they might have taken her.

{=gAX7S1Dv}I have a better idea. We would have a better chance if we split up now. I’ll take {RADAGOS.NAME} and go find the slaver market. You might wish to make inquiries in Ostican. It’s a port town, so they might have sailed on from there.
{=0b9pMp2k}In either case, we must be careful not to endanger their lives and it could be better to just buy them. We need to have our purses full for that though.
{=PjzGizrb}{SISTER.NAME} is the little sister of {PLAYER.NAME}. She was abducted by bandits and sold to a confederation of pirates and slave-traders known as the Sea Hounds.

{=WJWoYZjN}Ship Controls

{=dmvzpQB6}To control a ship, you must go to its command point and interact with it by pressing {INTERACTION_KEY}.{newline}{newline}This will let you control the ship, by using {FORWARD_KEY}, {LEFT_KEY}, {BACKWARDS_KEY}, {RIGHT_KEY}.

{=KeKD5ZQh}To control a ship, you must go to its command point and interact with it by pressing {INTERACTION_KEY}.{newline}{newline}This will let you control the ship, by using {CONSOLE_MOVEMENT_KEY}.
{=WJWoYZjN}Ship Controls

{=GjshORYB}To use the wind as efficiently as possible, check the ship widget in the lower right of your screen. The wind dial displays the direction of the wind - try to keep it within the green zones to generate the most forward force.{newline}{newline}Press {TOGGLE_SAIL_KEY} to unfurl the sail of your ship.
{=WJWoYZjN}Ship Controls

{=KbX6F14E}In order to change your active oarsman amount, press {TOGGLE_OARSMEN_KEY}.{newline}{newline}Now assign your entire crew to your oars. You can check your current oarsman status in the widget next to your health bar.
{=WJWoYZjN}Ship Controls
{=khb3aCsi}There are several different camera perspectives for your ship.{newline}{newline}Try switching between them by pressing {TOGGLE_CAMERA_KEY}.
{=WJWoYZjN}Ship Controls
{=w4OjKGij}When you want to slow down, you can furl your sails by pressing {TOGGLE_SAIL_KEY} again.{newline}{newline}You can also use your oarsmen by pressing {BACKWARDS_KEY}.
{=7iGN7BXX}When you want to slow down, you can furl your sails by pressing {TOGGLE_SAIL_KEY} again.{newline}{newline}You can also use your oarsmen via {CONSOLE_MOVEMENT_KEY}.
{=eDDEC3nL}Before you board an enemy ship, you must be close to them.{newline}{newline}Approach the enemy ship by using direct control.
{=YwDbCqPG}To attempt boarding, turn your camera to an enemy ship which is close to your ship, and press {ATTEMPT_BOARDING_KEY}.
{=QePRM5rH}Troop Orders

{=meRKiTQP}To give orders to your troops, select your own formation by pressing {FIRST_GROUP_HEAR_KEY} and select the order you want.{newline}{newline}Press {THIRD_ORDER_CATEGORY_KEY} to try “Charge” now!

{=8NoOrjMz}To give orders to your troops, open the formation selection by holding {HOLD_OPEN_ORDER_KEY} and select the order you want.{newline}{newline}Press {FIRST_ORDER_CATEGORY_KEY} and then {THIRD_ORDER_CATEGORY_KEY} to try “Charge” now!
{=1IpNoNL4}Cut Loose
{=YnX6iQcw}When your ship is connected to other ships, you can issue a cut loose order by pressing {CUT_LOOSE_KEY} while you are in direct control.
{=kKHU0bBT}Commanding Friendly Ships

{=UNi8a5Cg}You can command friendly ships, as long as you have the suitable authority.{newline}{newline}To command a ship to attack an enemy ship, press {SHIP_COMMANDING_TUTORIAL_GROUP_KEY} and then press {FOURTH_ORDER_CATEGORY_KEY} issue the engage order.

{=JganZqKL}The crew capacity of the ship. (Skeletal capacity - Deck capacity - Maximum capacity){newline}{newline}Skeletal capacity: The minimum number of troops the ship can carry without travel speed penalties.{newline}{newline}Deck capacity: The number of troops the ship can carry into battle.{newline}{newline}Maximum capacity: The maximum number of troops the ship can carry without travel speed penalties.{newline}{newline}Ships with higher maximum than deck capacity can carry reinforcements.
{=qwH3n6lM}Inventory capacity the ship provides.{newline}{newline}Going above this limit will cause travel speed penalties.

{=4rADpxvb}How heavy the ship is.{newline}{newline}Lighter ships are easier to maneuver and accelerate, but have more trouble in rough seas.{newline}{newline}Heavier ships are harder to accelerate, but handle rough seas better and deliver more devastating ramming attacks.
{=IdrIK6o1}Travel speed of the ship.

{=M0Tf0abB}Sail type of the ship.{newline}{newline}Square sails provide higher acceleration, with moderate top speeds and limited wind coverage.{newline}{newline}Lateen sails provide low acceleration, with higher top speeds and wider wind coverage.{newline}{newline}Ships with both sail types have good acceleration, wind coverage and top speeds.

{=DhG95b1Y}Draft type of the ship.{newline}{newline}Ships with shallow drafts travel faster through rivers and coastal seas, and slower through open waters.{newline}{newline}Ships with deep drafts travel slower through rivers and coastal seas, and faster through open waters.
{=wgTYB66x}Resilience of the ship against the elements.{newline}{newline}Ships with high sea worthiness take less attrition on open sea, and can even handle light storms.
{=UvmSrnyO}Hit points of the ship.
